title: One tricky slanted O in On Clip Plus logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203211im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/clipon_5215.jpg)
  
Any clues on that O used to make the spectacles? I have to rebuild this exquisite thing.
 [‹ (x) Sans serif used for fashion credits in Elle magazine - Interstate {Tiff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203211/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50331 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Atlantic's new heavyweight retro sans caps ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203211/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50323 "Go to next forum topic")
author: elzadra

comments.content: Looks like there’s Zapf Chancery and Brush Script in there, did you try either of those?

Well yes, I knew that. It was just the O’s. I ended up using a Zapf Chancery O and tinkering with it a bit. There’s so much wrong with this logo that a slightly off-kilter bezier curve isn’t going to make much difference.
